thread.title: 3 Rutgers offerees from the Michigan State game react to their tenders
thread.title_full: 3 Rutgers offerees from the Michigan State game react to their tenders

author: Todderick Hunt | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: 3 Rutgers offerees from the Michigan State game react to their tenders
text:
He thought Rutgers competed hard, narrowly losing to the No. 4 team in the country, 31-24 . 
"The way the players fought probably caught my attention the most and it was a honor to get a offer from a great program like Rutgers," Eley said. 
Hinish, a 6-3, 275-pound three-star defensive tackle, mentioned "brotherhood" as one thing that stood out most about his trek. 
"The game was great. I really enjoyed the game and the atmosphere," said Hinish. "I got to see the coaches in action and saw how the players interacted with one another. What stood out to me the most was the love the players had for one another. 
"It really seemed like a brotherhood there. I felt honored because of the opportunity put in front of me. Rutgers is a great school and they have a great team." 
Todderick Hunt may be reached at thunt@njadvancemedia.com . Follow him on Twitter @TodderickHunt . Find NJ.com Rutgers Football on Facebook .
